intro: Sedum lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf stonecrop, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It is a hardy succulent that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Sedum lanceolatum is also valued for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
